item.title: Building without designing
item.description: A quick one today, but an important one. When working at startups and in small development teams, something I’ve seen a lot is the dangerous idea that it is possible to write any kind of non-trivial software without having given it some serious thought first. I suspect this often comes from the classic abuse of the term “agile” as an excuse to drop some of the less tangibly essential aspects of software development and “just smash out some code”.
